citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The birds were not listed on the written program of veterinary care (PVC) for this facility. Failure to include birds on the
written PVC can result in a lack of veterinary guidance on the care of animals, adequate treatment, and consultation with
the attending veterinarian when there are animal health and well-being problems. The licensee must update the written
program of veterinary care to include birds.
Correct by: 01/03/2024

There was exposed sharp points in both the bobcat enclosure and the serval enclosure. There was an approximately
12inch long section of hardware cloth in the bottom of the dividing wall in the off exhibit area of the bobcat enclosure. The
gate to this area was left open, allowing the bobcat easy access to the wire patch and there was also visible urine
scalding at that section of fence. The serval had an 8inch section of hardware cloth with sharp edges turned into the
enclosure. Sharp point and edges are a potential risk to the health and welfare of the animals. Enclosures must be
maintained in good repair and protect the animals from injury.
Correct by: 12/27/2023

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility did not have a documented environment enhancement plan to promote psychological well-being of their avian
species as required by the Animal Welfare Act. The facility must develop, document and follow a species appropriate plan
for environmental enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by
the attending veterinarian, and at a minimum must address social grouping, environmental enrichment, special
considerations, restraint, and exemptions to the plan regulation and be in accordance with currently accepted professional
standards for each species group.
Correct by: 01/03/2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
KATHARINE FRANK, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
